00044 namespace Loki

00046 
00054     template <class T> struct CreateUsingNew
00055     {
00056         static T* Create()
00057         { return new T; }
00058 
00059         static void Destroy(T* p)
00060         { delete p; }
00061     };
00062 
00071     template<template<class> class Alloc>
00072     struct CreateUsing
00073     {
00074         template <class T>
00075         struct Allocator
00076         {
00077             static Alloc<T> allocator;
00078 
00079             static T* Create()
00080             {
00081                 return new (allocator.allocate(1)) T;
00082             }
00083 
00084             static void Destroy(T* p)
00085             {
00086                 //allocator.destroy(p);
00087                 p->~T();
00088                 allocator.deallocate(p,1);
00089             }
00090         };
00091     };
00092 
00101     template <class T> struct CreateUsingMalloc
00102     {
00103         static T* Create()
00104         {
00105             void* p = std::malloc(sizeof(T));
00106             if (!p) return 0;
00107             return new(p) T;
00108         }
00109 
00110         static void Destroy(T* p)
00111         {
00112             p->~T();
00113             std::free(p);
00114         }
00115     };
00116 
00117 
00128     template <class T> struct CreateStatic
00129     {
00130         union MaxAlign
00131         {
00132             char t_[sizeof(T)];
00133             short int shortInt_;
00134             int int_;
00135             long int longInt_;
00136             float float_;
00137             double double_;
00138             long double longDouble_;
00139             struct Test;
00140             int Test::* pMember_;
00141             int (Test::*pMemberFn_)(int);
00142         };
00143 
00144         static T* Create()
00145         {
00146             static MaxAlign staticMemory_;
00147             return new(&staticMemory_) T;
00148         }
00149 
00150         static void Destroy(T* p)
00151         {
00152             p->~T();
00153         }
00154     };
00155 
00156 
00157 
00172     template
00173     <
00174         typename T,
00175         template <class> class CreationPolicy = CreateUsingNew
00176     >
00177     class SingletonHolder
00178     {
00179     public:
00180 
00182         typedef T ObjectType;
00183 
00185         static T& Instance();
00186 
00187     private:
00188         // Helpers
00189         static void MakeInstance();
00190         static void DestroySingleton();
00191 
00192         // Protection
00193         SingletonHolder();
00194 
00195         // Data
00196         typedef T* PtrInstanceType;
00197         static PtrInstanceType pInstance_;
00198         static bool destroyed_;
00199     };
00200 
00202     // SingletonHolder's data
00204 
00205     template
00206     <
00207         class T,
00208         template <class> class C
00209     >
00210     typename SingletonHolder<T, C>::PtrInstanceType
00211         SingletonHolder<T, C>::pInstance_ = 0;
00212 
00213     template
00214     <
00215         class T,
00216         template <class> class C
00217     >
00218     bool SingletonHolder<T, C>::destroyed_ = false;
00219 
00221     // SingletonHolder::Instance
00223 
00224     template
00225     <
00226         class T,
00227         template <class> class CreationPolicy
00228     >
00229     inline T& SingletonHolder<T, CreationPolicy>::Instance()
00230     {
00231         if (!pInstance_)
00232         {
00233             MakeInstance();
00234         }
00235         return *pInstance_;
00236     }
00237 
00239     // SingletonHolder::MakeInstance (helper for Instance)
00241 
00242     template
00243     <
00244         class T,
00245         template <class> class CreationPolicy
00246     >
00247     void SingletonHolder<T, CreationPolicy>::MakeInstance()
00248     {
00249         if (!pInstance_)
00250         {
00251             if (destroyed_)
00252             {
00253                 destroyed_ = false;
00254             }
00255             pInstance_ = CreationPolicy<T>::Create();
00256         }
00257     }
00258 
00259     template
00260     <
00261         class T,
00262         template <class> class CreationPolicy
00263     >
00264     void
00265     SingletonHolder<T, CreationPolicy>::DestroySingleton()
00266     {
00267         assert(!destroyed_);
00268         CreationPolicy<T>::Destroy(pInstance_);
00269         pInstance_ = 0;
00270         destroyed_ = true;
00271     }

00289 #define LOKI_SINGLETON_EXPORT
00290 #endif
00291 
00292     template<class T>
00293     class LOKI_SINGLETON_EXPORT Singleton
00294     {
00295     public:
00296         static T& Instance();
00297     };

00306 #define LOKI_SINGLETON_INSTANCE_DEFINITION(SHOLDER)                     \
00307 namespace Loki                                                          \
00308 {                                                                        \
00309     template<>                                                          \
00310     SHOLDER::ObjectType&  Singleton<SHOLDER::ObjectType>::Instance()    \
00311     {                                                                   \
00312         return SHOLDER::Instance();                                     \
00313     }                                                                    \
